marketNews.title: APBN 5M25: Deficit 0.1%, Spending Starts to Increase
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance held another briefing (link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lKTy4NU0szw) on the realization of the 2025 State Budget (APBN) on Tuesday, 17 June. The main points are as follows: Revenue fell due to weaker tax receipts. State revenue for the first five months of 2025 (5M25) declined by 11.4% year-on-year, reaching only 33% of the 2025 APBN target (versus 40% in 5M24). The decline was mainly caused by tax revenue, which fell 10.1% YoY. Deputy Finance Minister Anggito Abimanyu attributed the drop in tax receipts to restitution factors, noting that gross tax revenue remains flat on an annual basis. At the end of May 2025 the government appointed a new Director General of Taxation, Bimo Wijayanto (link: https://news.ddtc.co.id/berita/nasional/1811040/baru-jadi-dirjen-pajak-ini-tugas-awal-bimo-wijayanto). Expenditure also started to rise in May 2025. Government spending for 5M25 also fell about 11% YoY, reaching only 28% of the 2025 APBN target (versus 34% in 5M24). The decline occurred amid efficiency initiatives ordered by President Prabowo Subianto since January 2025 (link: https://djpk.kemenkeu.go.id/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Inpres-1-Tahun-2025.pdf). Nevertheless, Deputy Finance Minister Suahasil Nazara said that spending surged in May 2025 as program reallocations within the budget became identified. In the next two months, spending is expected to be boosted by an economic stimulus of approximately IDR 24 trillion in June-July 2025 (link: https://setkab.go.id/presiden-prabowo-gulirkan-paket-stimulus-ekonomi-rp2444-triliun-untuk-jaga-momentum-pertumbuhan/). The realization of revenue and spending for 5M25 resulted in a deficit of IDR 21 trillion, equivalent to 0.09% of GDP, still far below the 2025 target of 2.53% of GDP. Sugar-sweetened beverage tax in packaged form (MBDK) was cancelled for this year. During the same briefing, Director General of Customs and Excise Djaka Budi Utama announced that the excise on packaged sweetened beverages will not be applied this year, although it may be introduced later (link: https://ekonomi.bisnis.com/read/20250617/259/1885747/resmi-cukai-minuman-manis-tidak-akan-berlaku-tahun-ini). Previously, at the beginning of 2025, the Director of Communication and User Guidance of Customs, Nirwala Dwi Heryanto, said the government planned to implement the MBDK tax in the second half of 2025, targeting revenue of IDR 3.8 trillion in the 2025 APBN. Key Takeaway: We assess that the accelerating trend in government spending will be a key factor to support economic growth in the second half of 2025, especially amid rising global uncertainty from US trade policy and geopolitical tensions. Low spending has been one of the reasons for the weak economic growth in 1Q25 (link: https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/ekonomi-ri-487-yoy-pada-1q25-terlemah-sejak-3q21). At the same time, the postponement of the MBDK tax may provide temporary relief for several issuers, namely $MYOR, $SIDO, $ULTJ, $CMRY and $ICBP.

marketNews.title: Other Hot News You Need to Know
marketNews.content: 1. Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei said on Wednesday, 18 June, that Iran will not accept "peace" and warned that any US attack would cause "serious, irreversible consequences" (link: https://aje.io/fcyxah?update=3783420). The statement came after US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday, 17 June, that Khamenei was an "easy target" and US patience was "running thin" (link: https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/trump-says-us-wont-kill-irans-supreme-leader-at-least-not-now-2025-06-17/). 2. Bank Indonesia decided to keep the BI Rate at 5.5% on Wednesday, 18 June, with the deposit facility and lending facility unchanged at 4.75% and 6.25% respectively (link: https://www.bi.go.id/id/publikasi/ruang-media/news-release/Pages/sp_2713325.aspx). 3. Bank Indonesia reported that bank credit growth slowed to +8.43% YoY in 5M25 (versus +8.88% YoY in 4M25), the lowest since June 2023. Investment credit grew +13.74% YoY, consumer credit +8.82% YoY, working-capital credit +4.94% YoY. Sharia financing grew +9.19% YoY and MSME credit +2.17% YoY (same source as above). 4. KPK Chairman Setyo Budiyanto told Bloomberg Technoz that the commission will summon BI Deputy Governor Filianingsih Hendarta as a witness in the alleged corruption case involving BI's corporate social responsibility funds for 2022-2023. The summons is scheduled between 17-19 June 2025 (link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-06-18/indonesia-to-summon-bi-deputy-as-witness-in-graft-case-technoz). 5. UMKM Minister Maman Abdurrahman said the government is studying new regulations to allow online-motorcycle-taxi drivers to be classified as micro-small-medium enterprises rather than formal employees. The regulation will be issued as a ministerial decree after consultations with the Transport, Communication and Digital, and Manpower ministries (link: https://nasional.kontan.co.id/news/pemerintah-menyiapkan-aturan-ojek-online-masuk-umkm). 6. Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani announced that the company will allocate IDR 130 trillion by the end of 2025 to support the government's 3-million-house-per-year program. The funding will come from the state-owned banks pool (Himbara) and Bank Syariah Indonesia ($BRIS) (link: https://nasional.kontan.co.id/news/danantara-siapkan-rp130-triliun-untuk-program-3-juta-rumah-modalnya-dari-mana). 7. Temasek Holdings said it welcomes the opportunity to cooperate with BPI Danantara after President Prabowo Subianto expressed his expectation for close collaboration between the two firms (link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-06-18/temasek-looks-to-work-with-indonesian-wealth-fund-danantara). 8. The Competition Commission (KPPU) gave conditional approval on Tuesday, 17 June, for the acquisition of PT Tokopedia by TikTok Nusantara (SG) Pte. Ltd. The conditional approval follows commitments on payment methods, logistics openness, and a ban on predatory pricing, and will be monitored until 17 June 2027 (link: https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/boards-policy-regulation/indonesia-antitrust-agency-gives-conditional-go-ahead-tiktoks-tokopedia-takeover-2025-06-18/). 9. SKK Migas announced that new oil and gas projects—Hidayah, Genting Oil, Geng North, and Andaman—are targeted to start on-stream operations in 2026 (link: https://industri.kontan.co.id/news/skk-migas-proyek-hidayah-genting-oil-geng-north-andaman-bakal-onstream-di-2026). 10. Wilmar Group reported that it handed over IDR 11.8 trillion to the Attorney General as a guarantee in a graft case concerning CPO exports for 2021-2022. The Jakarta Central District Court had acquitted Wilmar and two other companies in March 2025, but the Attorney General appealed and demanded the same amount as a fine. Wilmar said the money will be returned if the Supreme Court upholds the lower court decision, otherwise it may be seized (links: https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/indonesia-seizes-725-mln-wilmar-group-palm-oil-graft-case-2025-06-17/, https://www.tempo.co/hukum/wilmar-international-buka-suara-soal-penyitaan-rp-11-triliun-oleh-kejagung-1735452).

tickerNews.title: TOBA Has No Ongoing Cooperation Talks with Danantara
tickerNews.content: $TOBA: SVP Corporate Communications of TBS Energi Utama, Ratri Wuryandari, told Kontan that TOBA currently has no discussion or plan for cooperation with BPI Danantara. The statement came after rumors that TOBA might be among renewable energy issuers receiving investment from Danantara.

tickerNews.title: LABA Acquires 65% of PT Aceh Mineral Abadi
tickerNews.content: $LABA: Green Power Group announced that it has acquired 65% of PT Aceh Mineral Abadi for an undisclosed amount. The target company is applying for a copper and gold mining exploration permit covering 2,522 hectares. LABA said the acquisition secures upstream strategic resources for the electric-vehicle battery supply chain and that it is actively discussing cooperation with Chinese firms such as China Nonferrous Metal Mining, Jiangxi Copper, and Huayou Cobalt.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Forms Joint Ventures to Acquire Land for Development
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung, through its subsidiary PT Serpong Cipta Kreasi, established two joint ventures—PT Serpong Cahaya Harmoni and PT Serpong Cipta Lestari—to acquire a total of approximately 121.7 hectares of land valued at about IDR 3.7 trillion, implying a price of IDR 3 million per square meter. The land was bought from affiliated parties PT Variatata and PT Lestari Kreasi, which are also partners in the joint ventures. PT Serpong Cipta Kreasi holds a 60% stake in both joint ventures. The transaction is intended for new project development in the Summarecon Serpong area.

tickerNews.title: ACES Announces 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia announced a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 579.9 billion, or IDR 33.87 per share. This equals a 65% dividend payout ratio (2023: 75%) and implies a dividend yield of about 6.3% as of Wednesday, 18 June. The dividend is payable on the regular market with a cum-date on 25 June 2025 and payment on 17 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: TCPI Secures Nickel Ore Transport Contract
tickerNews.content: $TCPI: Transcoal Pacific obtained a contract to transport nickel ore worth USD 183 million from a non-affiliated nickel mining company in Southeast Sulawesi. The contract spans ten years with an estimated transport volume of 100 million tons.

tickerNews.title: NCKL Approves 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: $NCKL: Investor Daily reported that shareholders of Trimegah Bangun Persada approved a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 1.9 trillion, or IDR 30.33 per share. This corresponds to a 30% dividend payout ratio (2023: 30%) and a dividend yield of 4.3% as of Wednesday, 18 June. The cum-date and payment date have not been disclosed.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Prepares LBMA Certification
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi announced that its subsidiary PT Emas Murni Abadi is preparing for London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) certification. An independent assurance report, audited by Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Certified Public Accountants LLP, confirmed that the company's compliance report is fairly presented in all material aspects according to LBMA Responsible Gold Guidance.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Starts Commercial Operation of 25MW Solar Plant
tickerNews.content: $MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional, through its subsidiary PT Medco Power Indonesia, began commercial operation of a 25 MWp solar power plant in Karangasem, East Bali. The project was developed in partnership with Solar Philippines and includes a 20-year power purchase agreement with PLN. Over the next two decades, the plant will supply renewable energy to the local grid, replacing conventional sources, and is expected to generate about 50 GWh of clean electricity per year, enough for roughly 42,000 households.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Founder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina CEO Hasmoro purchased approximately 2.5 million HEAL shares at an average price of IDR 1,386 per share between 10 and 12 June 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 3.5 billion, raising Hasmoro's ownership from 4.7833% to 4.7996%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Involved in Danantara Housing Funding
tickerNews.content: CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, said the company will allocate IDR 130 trillion by the end of 2025 to support the government's program of building three million houses per year. The funding will come from the state-owned banks pool (Himbara) and Bank Syariah Indonesia ($BRIS). The housing financing scheme is currently being finalized.
